body_html:
debug symbols are probably most useful when built with your particular environment

This is not true. Debug symbols are always useful, even if you're running a binary on another environment.

SOP in Linux distro land is to distribute debug symbols separately from executable binaries, since they are pretty big. We might have trouble setting infrastructure for this. Maybe if we can make it easy for end users to build wheels, we can make this self service, which will be easier for us.

Reopening.

This is not true. Debug symbols are always useful, even if you're running a binary on another environment.
SOP in Linux distro land is to distribute debug symbols separately from executable binaries, since they are pretty big. We might have trouble setting infrastructure for this. Maybe if we can make it easy for end users to build wheels, we can make this self service, which will be easier for us.
Reopening.
body:
> debug symbols are probably most useful when built with your particular environment

This is not true. Debug symbols are always useful, even if you're running a binary on another environment.

SOP in Linux distro land is to distribute debug symbols separately from executable binaries, since they are pretty big. We might have trouble setting infrastructure for this. Maybe if we can make it easy for end users to build wheels, we can make this self service, which will be easier for us.

Reopening.
